Class FrameworkOps

java.lang.Object
org.tensorflow.framework.op.FrameworkOps
public class FrameworkOps extends Object
An API for building framework operations as Ops

These are higher level ops that may invoke core ops. Higher level Ops may perform the operation solely in the TensorFlow framework or do preprocessing of the Operands before invoking a core level Op.

    • create

      public static FrameworkOps create()
      Creates an API for building operations in the default eager execution environment

      Invoking this method is equivalent to FrameworkOps.create(EagerSession.getDefault()).

      Returns:
      the FrameworkOps

    • withSubScope

      public FrameworkOps withSubScope(String childScopeName)
      Returns an API that builds operations with the provided name prefix.

      @link Scope#withSubScope(String)}

      Parameters:
      childScopeName - name for the new child scope
      Returns:
      a new FrameworkOps that uses the child sub scope
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is invalid

    • withName

      public FrameworkOps withName(String opName)
      Returns an API that uses the provided name for an op.

      Scope.withName(String)

      Parameters:
      opName - name for an operator in the returned scope
      Returns:
      a new FrameworkOps that uses opName for operations.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is invalid

    • withDevice

      public FrameworkOps withDevice(DeviceSpec deviceSpec)
      Returns an API that places the created operations on the device(s) matching the provided spec.

      Scope.withDevice(DeviceSpec)

      Parameters:
      deviceSpec - the device specification for the scope
      Returns:
      the FrameworkOps

    • withControlDependencies

      public FrameworkOps withControlDependencies(Iterable<Op> controls)
      Returns an API that adds operations to the graph with the provided control dependencies.

      Scope.withControlDependencies(Iterable)

      Parameters:
      controls - the operations
      Returns:
      the FrameworkOps

    • withInitScope

      public FrameworkOps withInitScope()
      Returns an FrameworkOps that builds init operations.

      Init operations will be initialized at session creation, will have their inputs (and control inputs) made init ops as well, and are ignored when used as control dependencies. Additionally, this scope ignores any control dependencies.

      If an input can not be made an init op (i.e. a Placeholder), will throw an IllegalStateException on op creation.

      Returns:
      a FrameworkOps with a scope that builds init operations
